Job Purpose •    Build the Supply Chain Network models (digital twins) for strategic and tactical network optimisation. •    Integrate network design models in the regional supply chain functions to ensure repeatable review of supply chain network design and configuration. •    Develop the capability for Supply Chain network design and Supply Chain strategy in AkzoNobel by setting standards for modelling and data management as well as developing people. •    Support various network optimisation projects across AkzoNobel, based on ISC and business needs. Key Accountabilities Perform projects to develop Supply Chain network models and optimisations for Akzo Nobel •     Identify Supply Chain and business requirements for network models •     Data collection, validation and modelling •     Develop and validate baseline Network model (operational and financial validation) •     Run optimisation network scenarios (Unconstraint & constraint) •     Run standard what-if scenarios •     Run iterative inventory optimisation model versus optimised and selected what if scenarios •     Report key model outcome by scenario (using PowerBI) •     Operational changes •     Impact on Supply chain performance indicators (tbc): •     Lead time /service •     Reliability / Risk •     Supply chain costs •     Material cost •     Manufacturing cost •     Outbound Logistics cost •     Inventory •     SLOBS •     Carbon emission •     Define and prioritise top network change initiatives for implementation •     Business case preparation, presentation of its outcomes and recommendations to stakeholders Develop process and requirements for creating a standardised Supply Chain network flow model (digital twin) across Akzo Nobel that covers: •     Define data requirements (templates) and process for creating and updating the network flow model, allow for inclusion of: •     Customer segmentation •     Product segmentation •     Define standard scenarios for identifying the optimal supply chain Network and testing sensitivities and network options, to be used on a periodic basis with model refresh •     Define reporting requirements of model outputs (using PowerBI) •     Define process and capability to optimise inventory considering modelled optimised network. Use of iterative process with separate tool / module Experience •     Experience with supply chain network design optimisation tools - Lamasoft SC Guru, AIMMS, Anylogic •     Master or advanced university degree. Preferably in technical, data sciences, or supply chain management •     5+ years supply chain management and planning experience for a multinational company •     Excellent knowledge of databases, data processes, IT infrastructure, data modelling, and complex analysis •     Good to have experience on below tools: •     Data preparation/ transformation using Azure SQL, Alteryx •     Data visualization – Power BI, Tableau, SAP Analytics Cloud •     Working knowledge of SAP systems – ERP – standard tables, Tcodes, reports, BEX Analyzer, Analysis for Office •     Proven project experience with developing regional manufacturing & distribution network models. •     Team player strong in creating structure, timely, high quality deliverables •     Optimization practitioner with strong experience of strategic and tactical optimization - knowledge of the principles of optimization and how optimization is performed using software packages, familiarity with network optimization, inventory optimization, product flow analysis, operations planning, and cost to serve analysis. We are part of RHO (Recording Head Organization) embedded in Global Quality Organization who respond for overall quality monitoring of Seagate product shipping to customers. The big organization have an E2E product quality monitoring from upstream to downstream (Incoming Material through Field Customers). Be in charge of HGA Quality which is a department taking care of In overall HGA quality including seeking for room of improvement at Assembly / Test / Process Control starting from Material Incoming through Finish good Inventory. Your job can be divided into 2 main parts. The first one is to carefully monitor the Slider quality with deep-dive E2E analysis skill to capture the abnormality in any processes to ensure that we can deliver the good quality products to customers. 8D concepts will be applied to solve the complex issue and get the solid permanent actions. The second one is initiative projects driven by Industrial 4.0 and Prescriptive Approach concept. Continuous Improvement is the key focus of our department. We need to beat the yesterday. Ability to work under the pressure where your working result impact to product outgoing quality to customer. Highly motivated, passionate, organized, observant and self-disciplined individually. Be adaptable to work in a team or as an individual contributor. Be flexible and always exciting for the new challenges. Good written and oral communication skills in Thai & English Bachelor’s or master’s degree in engineering Field New Grad is considered. Deep Dive Data Analysis Skill Presentation skills both in Thai and in English Home to 4,000+ employees, our Teparuk site produces nano-recording heads, a crucial component of the read/write functionality of ahard disk drive. Our Teparuk facility is a fun and active site. Here at work you and your colleagues can grab breakfast, lunch, dinnerand snacks at our 24-7 on-site canteen and coffee shop. Get in a few laps around our running track or enjoy volleyball, ping pong,badminton or football through our on-site gymnasium and fitness center. We also offer music, dance and yoga activities. Enjoy manyon-site festivals and celebrations as well as opportunities to give back to the local community Location : Korat Thailand Travel : None

Job Description: SUMMARY OF POSITION The Flight Operations Engineer position is part of the flight operations support team. This position reports directly to the Head of Flight Operations Group. He/She works in close cooperation with the Airbus Flight Operations Support & Training Standards department (STL) in updating flight operations manuals (FCOM, QRH, FCTM, AFM, MMEL, CCOM, WBM) and answering to customer (Airlines) queries on flight operations matter. The deliverables (flight operations manuals, flight operations technical answers and related supports) are provided worldwide to the customers for all Airbus aircraft programs. Duties & Responsibilities This position is responsible for flight operations support activities including, but not limited to: Operational standards: Author and coordinate the authoring of relevant flight operations manuals according to the Flight Operational Standards defined by STL Update relevant flight operations manuals according to aircraft definition, operational feedbacks and requests from the customers, authorities/agencies or internals Manage aircraft configuration to ensure coverage of individual aircraft definition in relevant flight operations manuals Operational support to customers: Answer to customer queries on flight operations matter upon STL requests Ensure that all flight operations concerns and needs raised by the customers are well assessed and addressed within the defined time scale CORE JOB Requirement Bachelor degree in aeronautical engineering 2 to 5 years of experience in airline operations or equivalent Advanced level of communication skills in English General knowledge of aircraft systems Sturdy knowledge of IT tools and particularly in the authoring of structured documentation in XML Familiar with an international and multifunctional environment Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities Good customer service mindset Good team player This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth. Company: Airbus Flight Operations Services Limited Employment Type: Permanent ------- Experience Level: Professional Job Family: Testing By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com.At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Job Title: Trade Compliance Specialist SEA Summary: Critical position add in Thailand to ensure full coverage of customs and foreign trade regulations being covered in local operational processes. Responsibilities Include: Is responsible for the timely execution of NPI WF customs step, incl. HS code assessment, origin determination and full regulatory screening in view of applicable Import & Export Control regulations, incl. license requirements Is responsible for the product HS classification process, using Classifier tool and managing the interface between 3rd party system and SAP Has a key role in leading the Origin and Preferential Origin calculation for Momentive finished goods. This includes working with local operational teams and 3rd party on origin determination, origin declarations, as well as origin certifying documentation. Acts as contact person to local TH customs and other governmental agencies as required Provides training and coaching to key stakeholders periodically, incl. regulatory updates and compliance awareness Collaborate with global team members, business and other key stakeholders and ensure global trade compliance policies are followed locally Work with 3rd party customs brokers and apply regular and systematic audit discipline Lead trusted trader programs with Thailand customs, as apply Support or lead continuous improvement projects regarding customs and trade compliance initiatives; Identify potential risks and develop actionable plans to mitigate. Qualifications: The following are required for the role Min 5 years of work experience in Customs and Trade Customs Specialist certified in Thailand Solid SAP user skills, preferably GTS module Experienced in Customs valuation and classification under the Harmonized Tariff Schedule, Free Trade Agreement incl. product preferential origin calculation, export controls, and/or other technical areas related to international trade activity Demonstrated strengths will include a highly collaborative work style, the ability to anticipate problems, success in resolving difficult situations and effective communication. Ability to work independently and pro-actively, with minimal guidance and supervision from remote. Ability to exercise leadership, self-initiative, and sound judgment. Proficiency in a technology-enabled environment – experience with trade automation, global trade management systems/software and data analytic tools is highly sought after such as SAP and Excel. Ability to travel domestically and internationally, as required (approx.. 10%) #LI-PP1 What We Offer: At Momentive, we value your well-being and offer competitive total rewards and development programs. Our inclusive culture fosters a strong sense of belonging and provides diverse career opportunities to help you unleash your full potential. Together, through innovative problem-solving and collaboration, we strive to create sustainable solutions that make a meaningful impact. Join our Momentive team to open a bright future. #BePartoftheSolution About Us: Momentive is a premier global advanced materials company with a cutting-edge focus on silicones and specialty products. We deliver solutions designed to help propel our customer’s products forward—products that have a profound impact on all aspects of life, around the clock and from living rooms to outer space. With every innovation, Momentive creates a more sustainable future. Our vast product portfolio is made up of advanced silicones and specialty solutions that play an essential role in driving performance across a multitude of industries, including agriculture, automotive, aerospace, electronics, energy, healthcare, personal care, consumer products, building and construction, and more. Momentive believes a diverse workforce empowers our people, strengthens our business, and contributes to a sustainable world. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any characteristic protected by law. To be considered for this position candidates are required to submit an application for employment and be of legal working age as defined by local law. An offer may be conditioned upon the successful completion of pre-employment conditions, as applicable, and subject to applicable laws and regulations. Note to third parties: Momentive is not seeking or accepting any unsolicited assistance from search and selection firms or employment agencies at this time.

Welcome! Please submit your resume and concerned documents for interview consideration.

Job_Description: วุฒิการศึกษา - ปริญญาตรี สาขาวิชาชีพ - วิศวกรรมศาสตร์ - วิทยาศาสตร์ เงินเดือน/ค่าตอบแทน ตามโครงสร้างบริษัทฯ ตำแหน่ง 1 ตำแหน่ง รายละเอียดของงาน 1.ศึกษาพัฒนาผลิตภัณฑ์และวางแผนการพัฒนาผลิตภัณฑ์ที่เหมาะสมและเป็นไปตามนโยบาย 2.วางแผนพัฒนาผลิตภัณฑ์และธุรกิจให้เป็นไปตามนโยบายบริษัท 3.ประสานงานกับฝ่ายที่เกี่ยวข้องเพื่อดำเนินการพัฒนาผลิตภัณฑ์ใหม่ 4.มีความรู้ ความเข้าใจในแผง solar cell เป็นอย่างดี 5.ต้องพัฒนาต่อยอดคุณภาพกระจก solar cover glass ให้ได้ตามความต้องการ 6.อื่นๆ ตามที่ได้รับมอบหมาย คุณสมบัติผู้สมัคร ชาย/หญิง อายุ 20 - 30 ปีขึ้นไป ไม่จำกัดสถานภาพสมรส ปริญญาตรี สาขา วิศวกรรม/วิทยาศาสตร์ มีประสบการณ์ ด้านอุตสาหกรรมการผลิตแผงโซล่าร์เซลล์ ตั้งแต่ 2 ปีขึ้นไป สามารถสื่อสารภาษาอังกฤษได้ รายละเอียดบริษัท / สวัสดิการ เป็นผู้ผลิตกระจกลวดลายแห่งเดียวให้ประเทศไทย ซึ่งได้รับการยอมรับจากกว่า 60 ประเทศทั่วโลก ด้วยกำลังการผลิตที่มากกว่า 60,000 ตันต่อปี มีผลิตภัณฑ์ให้เลือกทั้งกระจกลายใส และสี มากถึง 7 สี และ 20 ลวดลาย เรามุ่งเน้นกระบวนการผลิตให้มีประสิทธิภาพและคุณภาพตามมาตรฐานที่กำหนด และ มุ่งเน้นการพัฒนาความสามารถของบุคลากรในองค์กรเพื่อผลิตสินค้าและบริการที่ดีมีคุณภาพออกสู่ตลาด อีกทั้งยังให้ความสำคัญกับสังคม เพราะเราเชื่อว่าธุรกิจและสังคมเป็นสิ่งเกื้อหนุนกัน จึงมีนโยบายทางต้าน CSR ( Corporate Social Responsibility ) เพื่อขับเคลื่อนองค์กรและสังคมให้ ก้าวไปด้วยกันอย่างมั่นคง บริษัท กระจกลวดลายไทย จำกัด ยังคงพัฒนาผลิตภัณฑ์ต่างๆ ออกสู่ตลาด เพื่อตอบโจทย์ความต้องการของผู้บริโภค และเทคโนโลยีที่กำลังพัฒนาไปในอนาคต เรามีความมุ่งมั่นที่จะสรรสร้างผลิตภัณฑ์ และนวัตกรรมกระจกลวดลายเพื่อก้าวสู่ความเป็นผู้นำในการผลิตกระจกลวดลายของโลก อย่างมั่นคง ที่อยู่ของบริษัท/สำนักงาน บริษัท กระจกลวดลายไทย จำกัด 83 ม. 5 แขวงท่าข้าม เขตบางปะกง จังหวัดฉะเชิงเทรา 24130 อีเมล์ : pheraya@thaipatternedglass.com โทร : 061-2730255 เว็บไซต์ : www.thaipatternedglass.com

Overview Weatherford is a leading global energy services company. Our world-class experts partner with customers to optimize their resources and realize the full potential of their assets. Across our operating locations, including manufacturing, research and development, service, and training facilities, operators choose us for strategic solutions that add efficiency, flexibility, and responsibility to any energy operation. We are focused on technology development, digital solutions, and defining our footprint in the new energy space. Our ability to provide integrated solutions across our segments will be critical to growth in our core operations and the energy transition. Energy producers face unique challenges every day, so it is our job to create solutions that enhance safety, streamline operations, and sustain uptime to meet or exceed their targets. We operate across the global energy landscape employing some of the best diverse talent in the industry. At Weatherford, we understand the value each individual brings to the table. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and are immensely proud of our workforce. We invite you to join our passionate, talented, world-class team. When you join Weatherford, you instantly feel connected to something bigger - a community that is grounded by our core values and driven to create innovative solutions for our customers. We celebrate each other's successes, grow together, and learn from each other constantly. Individually, we are impressive. Together, we are unstoppable. We are One Weatherford. Weatherford offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits program and provides you a challenging and enriching career path, with a healthy balance of structure and flexibility to chart your own course. Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Responsibilities The Material Handler utilizes hand trucks, forklifts, hoists, conveyors, or other handling equipment to move material to and from , trucks, trailers, vans, or trains and within the storage facility. Loads and unloads material within a warehouse or storage facility. Relies on instructions and pre-established procedures and guidelines to perform the functions of the job is responsible to count, receive, store, ship and replenish inventory goods associated with the warehouse. The Warehouse Material Handler works under the close direction of senior personnel in the functional area. The Warehouse Material Handler will report to the Warehouse Lead or Warehouse Manager. Responsible for credit return inventory by arranging for the inspection of materials; verifying count, part number and properly transacting returned inventory back into stock. Responsible for documenting/recording of inventory movement within the warehouse when inventory is relocated to optimize efficiencies. Responsible for documenting/recording of inventory shipped from the warehouse. Responsible for Identifying and labelling of material, as well as recording/assigning and placing it in its assigned locations on the shelves to maintain inventory. Responsible for lifting equipment operations to include loading and unloading of incoming and outgoing inventory. Responsible for performing and reporting of cycle counts assigned by inventory supervisor/manager. Responsible for preparing and securing outgoing inventory orders for shipment to destination. Responsible for pulling and verifying inventory listed on incoming orders sent to the warehouse. Responsible for staging of secured outgoing inventory in designated staging area. Responsible for the pre-use inspections and preventative maintenance of lifting equipment assigned to the warehouse. Responsible to count, receive, store, ship and replenish inventory goods associated with the warehouse. Ensures material is handled, packaged, or stored in a way that does not cause damage or harm to people, process or product. Qualifications High school Diploma or equivalent. Knowledge of commonly-used practices, and procedures within warehouse management. Ability to collaborate with others and have good team-building skills. Ability and willingness to use warehousing equipment including pallet jacks, forklifts, cranes, wrapping machines etc. Positive attitude, with a high degree of self-discipline and self-motivation. Capable of using own initiative and working at times unsupervised. Proficient typing and general computer skills. Basic written and verbal communication skills. PREFFERED 1-5 years of experience working in a warehouse setting. Certification training for forklift truck operations. Ability to work under pressure with little supervision. Perform transactions in ERP system (JDE, One C, etc.). Willingness to work flexible hours, including overtime and weekends.

Date: 8 Jan 2024 Location: Rayong, TH Company: Tetra Pak At Tetra Pak we commit to making food safe and available, everywhere; and we protect what's good – protecting food, protecting people, and protecting the planet. By doing so we touch millions of people's lives every day. And we need people like you to make it happen. Logistics Officer Tetra Pak is looking for a Logistics Officer who supports function with data and logistics KPI analysis. Identify and highlight key areas for attention and improvement. This is permanent role based in Rayong, Thai Lan What you will do As a Logistics Officer, you will: Daily coordination with relevant departments for customer deliveries Managing inbound and outbound shipments and ensure compliance with customs regulations Coordinate with freight forwarder, customs broker and Supply Chain Control Tower for shipment booking and monitoring Issue invoices & provide shipping documents to customers Maintain and update files on carriers’ rates and quotations Initiate logistics cost improvement activities Prepare reports on performance, deploy losses and eliminate anomalies Participate in World Class Manufacturing activities We believe you have Degree in Logistics, Business, or any other related field At least 3 years of experience as a logistics officer or relevant position Fluent in English Experience working with SAP is an advantage Ability to work under pressure carrying out several tasks simultaneously to completion Committed team player We Offer You A variety of exciting challenges with ample opportunities for development and training in a truly global landscape A culture that pioneers a spirit of innovation where our industry experts drive visible results An equal opportunity employment experience that values diversity and inclusion Market competitive compensation and benefits with flexible working arrangements Apply Now If you are inspired to be part of our promise to protect what’s good; for food, people, and the planet, apply through our careers page at https://jobs.tetrapak.com/.

At Beiersdorf, we want to help people feel good about their skin – and our commitment goes far beyond caring for skin. For 140 years, we have developed innovative skin and body care products for well-known brands such as NIVEA, Eucerin, La Prairie, Hansaplast, and Labello. We act according to our purpose, WE CARE BEYOND SKIN, and take responsibility for our consumers, our employees, the environment and society. Behind every brand, every product and every accomplishment are our more than 20,000 employees. It is for them that we live an inclusive culture of respect and trust that is strongly aligned with our values – CARE, COURAGE, SIMPLICITY and TRUST. We also embrace diversity by valuing the uniqueness of each individual and being committed to equal opportunities for all. Your Tasks Lead inbound/outbound/reverse logistics, inventory control & warehouse operation. Assure results delivered according to KPIs. Direct and guide the Thailand logistics operation team on daily problem analysis and decision making. Collaborate with Sales & CS team for execution of outbound delivery per customer needs. Ensure distribution service operate smoothly. Conduct regular meeting with LSPs, identifying issues and actions needed to be taken. Maintain budgetary and report warehousing, logistics & distribution KPI’s against targets, such as logistics Spend, On Time Delivery, Load Efficiency etc., monthly to senior management. Assure compliance and quality assurance standards. Coordination with BDF Quality Assurance function. Strategize with cross functions and LSPs to identify opportunities for continuous improvements & cost saving to the current supply chain network. Manage & track for write off status and discipline for destruction schedule. Support information for logistics contract study & RFQ and be a key member of negotiation team. Take role of local logistics key user Responsible for BDF Thailand exportation to export 3rd countries. Responsible for the performance of ASEAN Inbound Tower ensuring timely execution of sea & air transport to ASEAN and acting as the point of escalation for stakeholders of ASEAN Inbound tower i.e. MU Supply Towers & CU Logistics. Your Profile Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Engineering, or specializing in Logistics management. 5+ years logistics experience & project management in leadership position Strong SAP skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Power point, Words) Knowledge of end-to-end logistics operations (including ocean, sea, road transportation, and warehousing) Excellent English verbal and written communication skills Entrepreneurial mindset Additional information Office Location:6th and 7th Fl. Sathorn Square Office Tower, 98 North Sathorn Road, Silom, Bangrak, Bangkok 10500.  (Remotely Working from home could be applied) Job Details Contract Type: Unlimited / Full-Time Job Start Date: 1/8/2024 Country / City: Thailand / Bangkok Company: Beiersdorf (Thailand) Co. About Toll Group At Toll, we do more than just logistics - we move the businesses that move the world. Our 16,000 team members can help solve any logistics, transport, or supply chain challenge - big or small. We have been supporting our customers for more than 130 years. Today, we support more than 20,000 customers worldwide with 500 sites in 27 markets, and a forwarding network spanning 150 countries. We are proudly part of Japan Post - www.tollgroup.com Handle all Airfreight business for import, export, land-air, transit shipment, transshipment incl understanding of customs clearance process and regulations. Collaboration with networks, sales, and clients to gain more opportunities to win business and create new products to support the growth of Airfreight including joint sales visit. Engage on the pricing for tender and local inquiries, proposal for new solutions, and working in closely with Local/Global tender team incl Regional/Global Airfreight Products. Provide Monthly Business Review, business planning for Airfreight development, initiative for cost saving and increased profitability incl productivity of department. Negotiate competitive /Ad-Hoc rate and long-term deals with the carriers and vendors ( Rates and space allocations) incl transportation vendors. Monitoring that comprehensive rates, schedules and other information are continually updates on Toll's share point. Control and monitoring on invoicing, AR overdue, accuracy of accrual and billing to clients included completed shipment on time of CW1 (operation system) and meet KPIs of internal Business Process and all specific requirements. Leadership management to boost up the capacity and motivation of Airfreight team to work closely, efficiency, smooth operations, problem solving, prompt response with the good service and communication with internal and external customers. Other task as assigned by management What moves you? At Toll, you can help play a vital role in delivering what matters. From food, fuel, medicine and rescue services, we keep businesses and communities thriving. Every day brings change. We see that as an opportunity. To be curious. To ask the right questions. And build meaningful connections. Because finding new ways to solve problems is what we do. With a bold vision to expand our global reach, our 16,000+ people bring a passion for progress. We collaborate in friendly, caring teams, supported by approachable leaders who give us the autonomy to quickly make decisions with impact. Learn and grow with industry-leading training, alongside talented experts. Feel empowered to take on diverse challenges and new responsibilities to move you, our customers, and our world further. Are you excited about this role but are concerned you don't meet all the requirements? If you have similar skills and are willing to learn then we encourage you to apply anyway. We know that some people hesitate to apply for jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Toll, we value a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you're interested in this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly then please talk to us - you may be just the right candidate for this or other roles we have coming up. At Toll everyone is welcome including those of all ages, ethnicities, genders and abilities. To find out more about us visit www.careers.tollgroup.com

Job Purpose This role is to lead all production and operational activities, supervising staff, organizing and monitoring work flow , and ensuring company standards of efficiency and quality. Planning and coordinating work schedules, assignments and production processes to meet production goals Manage plant manufacturing assets, driving improvement in costs, quality and productivity. Provide leadership for the successful in operation & manufacturing Key Accountabilities •    Assist Production manager to systemize and controls production related activities at the site to meet objectives and budgets with regard to quality, costs and service. •    Contributes to successful product and volume reallocations. •    Co-develops and executes plans related to improving quality, costs, HSE and service in conjunction with the Site Management Team. •    Participates in the definition of investments for production related activities and equipment. •    Works with RD&I to enable New Product Initiatives, of which product responsibility is accepted from RD&I after three successful batches. •    Calls-off all required non-product related resources (Site Operation Consumable & Services and real estate including facilities). •    Oversee and contributes to the implementation of CI / ALPS initiatives •    To perform other tasks as assigned by Production Manager Experience Bachelor's Degree or higher in Engineering or related fields. New graduated or 1-2 years of experience of related industry experience. (Experience in Chemical plant is an advantage) Knowledge of production management. Knowledge of quality management systems. Knowledge of SAP systems. Strong leadership skills and ability to motivate employees at all levels. Strong English verbal and written communication skills. Strong decision-making, problem-solving, multitasking and organizational skills. Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interface with all levels of personnel from workers to top management. Strong analytical skills and attention to detail Excellent ability to manage time and resources to meet deadlines. Job Overview TE Connectivity's Supply Chain Managers are responsible for the timely, cost-effective procurement, inventory control, planning and quality control of production materials. They ensure the availability of materials in the supply chain, as scheduled, and the maintenance of inventory at the established levels. They coordinate and integrate the flow of materials and information among suppliers, manufacturers, distributors and customers, identifying opportunities for improving efficiency, effectiveness and capabilities of the supply chain. Resources are focused on continuous improvement of the movement of materials through production processes, and the establishment of key performance metrics and benchmarks to monitor actual performance against goals. What your background should look like: Job Summary - Supply Chain Analyst II (Gateway) Focus on supply chain planning Job Qualification •    Degree graduate is any discipline •    SAP knowledge is preferred •    Minimum 3-5 years of experience in Supply Chain •    Fluency in English •    Good in Microsoft (Excel / Power Point) Job Responsibilities •    Prepare 3-months MPs •    Prepare 3-month raw materials requirement to suppliers •    Review the capacity monthly and trigger capacity expansion if required •    Prepare monthly production plan •    Work closely with Operation to ensure the production plan is executed as planned •    Close monitoring the components to support the production plan •    Work closely with suppliers to ensure on time delivery of components to support in house production •    Review and provide confirmation for each Interco customer order received •    Review the customer order CRD to ensure KPI is met •    Review PDR to ensure the KPI is met •    Prepare ad hoc report as required

Your Job Lead the Manufacturing functions (Production, Maintenance/Tooling fabrication). This to support all production activities to meet the organize’ s short and long-term business objectives. Also conducted accordance with the relevant health, safety, environmental and quality standard cost effectively and in timely manner to meet the customer’s need and expectations. Our Team You will report directly to Plant Manager and supervise Senior Maintenance Supervisor / Section Manager of Production while co-ordinating with all internal departments and external vendors. What You Will Do Be a lead of production team by supporting and supervise in production activities, to ensure stable of the production process and to help achieve department goals and/or RREs matrices. Establish work force plans for all manufacturing operations balancing, productivity, sales, outside manufacturing sources and manpower capacity to determine optional manpower requirements. To manage and control production activities through supervisors to achieve timely production of quality products per applicable quality standards, at the most economical costs and in proper quantities. Identify and drive process improvement opportunities that will result in improved labor efficiency, productivity, promote cost reduction etc. Identify and implement opportunities for improving workplace safety and ergonomics as well as process improvement opportunities that will result in improved labor efficiency, productivity, promote cost reduction etc. Ensure all established safety, quality, delivery, and cost commitments are met. Enable and support training initiatives that ensure all assigned employees are aware of and comply with company policies, government regulations, and customer policies/requirements, procedures and regulations. Develop training plan and training matrix for production team. Responsibility to maintain exemplary personal, work, communication habits, labor resourcing and absenteeism. Coordination in production activities with all other functions of the organization and maintain optimum production with utilization of human resources, machines, and equipment. Provide leadership and guidance to production personnel, working closely with Human Resources to handle any applicable personnel issues. Be able to stand by in case of production problems, which needed to fix on urgent basis. Performing continuous improvements and 6S-workshops Manage/control/ensure the proper and adequate maintenance of both documentation and machinery, tools, equipment, and facilities within the Department. It includes stock management of spare parts and necessary operating supplies. Manage/control/ensure that all production procedures, job descriptions, specifications, machinery and equipment requirements and maintenance are strictly followed according to established documents. Manage/control/ensure that the facilities, machines, and equipment within the responsible Department are safe and can safely be operated by employees. Manage company equipment according to company regulations to enable and support company overall operations and to preserve company assets. Who You Are (Basic Qualifications) Bachelor's or Master's degree in any related field. Minimum 5 years of relevant experience including 5 years in management level. Experienced interacting with all levels of management/staff and across organizational lines. Strong supervisory skills with knowledge in SAP (Purchasing, Material Management, Production Plan module and QM quality notification.) Very good command of both spoken and written in English. Logistics Coordinator will base in customer site (Ranong province) and responsible for logistics operations and coordination between Bollore and customer. WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING • Coordinate outbound shipment with operation teams for shipment arrangement. • Prepare shipping instruction or other document required for export shipment. • Issue export shipping document from SAP system. • Coordinate and prepare shipping instruction or other document required for Import & Export • Following up and update the status of shipment to customer until cargo deliver to consignee. • Track updates on any change in ETA date and inform to both logistics teams & customer operation teams. • Collate all e-mail & shipping documentations. • Coordination with origin for shipment arrangement & Pre Alert ( And do the additional document required if required) • Perform sanitary-Check with reference to customer standard Import shipment instruction (SSI) • Clearance Coordination and delivery (include coordinate with customs agent and customer internal operation) • Data input into customer internet for shipping KPI (workspace) • Maintain individual shipment movement reporting / record. • Request transport to all vendors. But the rate provided by each vendor have to keep secret, cannot share with other FF. • Coordinate and sent approval request to Product line for Export & Ranong shipment. • Manage and select reasonable MOT for each inbound and outbound shipment, including local transport (domestics trucking vs domestics airfreight. • Verify logistics requirement for production and request additional information if needed. (completed detail of request) • Providing close monitoring on critical shipments. • Manage consolidation control for export, international and local delivery transportation. • Monitor any irregularity incident, and report to one logistics teams. • Prepare Tempo report each month. • Prepare weekly report for both Import & Export, Ranong shipment. • Control inventory for customer cargoes at Ranong Free zone or Bonded. • Escalate issue to One logistics Teams. • Additional task as per one logistics teams may assigned. • Attend operation meeting, if requested to report status of shipment Requirements THE SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE Essential: • Bachelor’s degree in logistics / finance / administrative / accounting • 3 Years' working experience in Logistics Role • Familiar with Oil & Gas operation • Good command in English Desirable: • Team work attitude with leadership capabilities • Strong networking and influencing skills Benefits Benefits Provident Fund Group Insurance: Health (IPD&OPD), Accident, and Dental Fixed & Performance Bonus Annual Leave start from 12 days/year

Overview Weatherford is a leading global energy services company. Our world-class experts partner with customers to optimize their resources and realize the full potential of their assets. Across our operating locations, including manufacturing, research and development, service, and training facilities, operators choose us for strategic solutions that add efficiency, flexibility, and responsibility to any energy operation. We are focused on technology development, digital solutions, and defining our footprint in the new energy space. Our ability to provide integrated solutions across our segments will be critical to growth in our core operations and the energy transition. Energy producers face unique challenges every day, so it is our job to create solutions that enhance safety, streamline operations, and sustain uptime to meet or exceed their targets. We operate across the global energy landscape employing some of the best diverse talent in the industry. At Weatherford, we understand the value each individual brings to the table. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and are immensely proud of our workforce. We invite you to join our passionate, talented, world-class team. When you join Weatherford, you instantly feel connected to something bigger - a community that is grounded by our core values and driven to create innovative solutions for our customers. We celebrate each other's successes, grow together, and learn from each other constantly. Individually, we are impressive. Together, we are unstoppable. We are One Weatherford. Weatherford offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits program and provides you a challenging and enriching career path, with a healthy balance of structure and flexibility to chart your own course. Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Responsibilities The Drilling Services Reliability Engineer is the key resource of the country location in assurance of flawless Service Delivery execution, all aspects of which are defined in the Service Delivery Charter. This position serves the purpose a functional link between operational personnel and the Service Delivery Manager to ensure necessary support is provided to comply with all expectations of Service Delivery. Prepare and present monthly safety and quality statistics to the operations team within the location ensuring the information is uploaded to WPTS and provided to all personnel within the location Implement, evaluate, and improve the efficiency of Operational Control Plan processes to enhance quality, efficiency and output of each location. Review and approve (or return) each WPTS Job Report submitted following the completion of an operational activity. Lead the Management of Change process as required for both workshop and field operations ensuring compliance to the Management of Change standard and closure of Management of Change is completed when required. Interface with the operations personnel on issues relating to service quality such as processes, procedures, and technical updates and be fully involved in the management of change of these with all parties concerned. Complete the Tier 1 audit on an annual basis to ensure operational excellence and compliance to various aspects of service delivery and communicate with Service Delivery Manager as required. Ensure client service delivery expectations are being met. Perform regular audits on workshop maintenance processes, rig operation procedures and ensure compliance with Governance Material. Lead Corrective Preventative Action Report investigations (CPAR) and ensure these incidents are being communicated within the work flow. Assist in the preparation and delivery of investigation presentations to the client. Ensure equipment upgrade bulletins are being implemented and followed, maintain the Notification Tracker System to ensure compliance Support with contract review and coordinate the compliance to existing contractual obligations from Service Delivery aspects. Oversee training and competence strategy for the location consistent with company global processes and goals. Support with competency assessment where required and their quality checks. Ensure that critical suppliers are subject to audit and work with local teams to set and measure KPIs. Assist with improving supplier performance as required. Ensure that processes for equipment integrity are in place and drive continual improvement in equipment performance, reliability, safety and legal compliance, working with the product line, manufacturing, research and development as required. Assist with the location Management Review meetings on an annual basis taking the lead for all corrective actions identified. Any other delegated responsibilities as instructed by Line Management within the timeframe specified in a safe and efficient manner to meet business requirements, provided the instruction is reasonable and you are capable and deemed competent to fulfil these. Qualifications Mechanical, Electronic, Petroleum engineering or relevant discipline. 2 - 5 year of Drilling Service operations or DS R&M experience. Advance Root Cause Analysis training is preferred Previous experience in reliability roles is preferred English Language: Has fully operational command of the spoken and written language with only occasional unsystematic inaccuracies and deficiencies. Misunderstandings may occur in unfamiliar situations. Handles complex detailed argumentation well. Comprehensive knowledge and operational understanding of Drilling Services Operations and equipment. Possess strong customer service skills, i.e. listening, follow-through, willingness to help. Good understanding and knowledge of QHSE Management systems. Good presentation, analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to resolve complex issues. Must be able to work closely and communicate interactively with all level of employees with Weatherford, supply chain, sub-contractor, and client base. Good computer skills in a Microsoft Windows environment. Must include knowledge of Excel, Word, Power Point, MS Project. Ability to work well with all levels of personnel.

Job_Title: Supply Chain Manager (National Position) (Re-advertisement), Based in Mae Sot
Job_Description:
: International Rescue Committee : 28 Nov 2023 14 / December / 2023 Job Title: Supply Chain Manager (National Position) Sector: Supply Chain Employment Category: Fixed Term Employment Type: Full-Time Open to Expatriates: No Location: Mae Sot District Soi 14, Thailand Application Deadline: 14 December 2023 Job Description Background/IRC Summary: The International Rescue Committee (IRC) responds to the world’s worst humanitarian crises, helping to restore health, safety, education, economic wellbeing, and power to people devastated by conflict and disaster. Founded in 1933 at the call of Albert Einstein, the IRC is at work in over 40 countries and 26 U.S. cities helping people to survive, reclaim control of their future and strengthen their communities. The IRC has been operating in Thailand since 1975 and currently provides assistance to displaced persons in Tak, Kanchanaburi, Ratchaburi and Mae Hong Son provinces. Job Overview/Summary:
The Supply Chain Manager works to provide supply chain service and ensure IRC and donor compliance in the procurement of goods including warehouse, inventory vehicle and assets services for IRC. The Supply Chain Manager will liaison with all program staff in Tak. Major Responsibilities:
Ensure effective transportation solutions to support the smooth warehouse operation and program efficiency. Participate the inventory counts activities and ensure the stock accuracy at all the responsible warehouses locations Procurement Planning Develop procurement plans for active grants, in collaboration with program Coordinators/Managers and internal and external stakeholders to support program implementation Ensure program teams develop distribution plan for supplies and assets of closed grants in the warehouses Facilitate coordination of supply chain field staffs to ensure that there are sufficient spaces in warehouses before receiving or dispatching Implementing all IRC procurement SOPs Implement sourcing strategies and relationships with suppliers Monitor supply market and conduct market surveys & analysis Procurement Management Lead tender process (RFQ and RFP processes), and completing a purchase request process Prepare, review and utilize Procurement contracts, including Master Agreements (MPA, MSA) for purchases, and ensure the documentation process in accordance with the IRC guidelines Prepare and submit timely and accurate supply chain report(s) to support decision-making process Maintain relationships with suppliers, and program staffs Ensure the supplier evaluation and the agreement renewal in time Inventory, warehousing, and asset management • Ensure appropriate warehouse set-up with suitable warehousing capacity • Ensure implementation of warehouse system and control mechanism in accordance with the IRC inventory policies including cycle count, reporting discrepancies, pharmaceutical quality assurance well as cold chain policies • Ensure inventory management, including drug storage, cold chain, food, and non-food commodities • Coordinate inventory disposal procedures • Conduct Asset needs assessment • Handle asset and property disposal, and auction management • Ensure effective transportation solutions to support the smooth warehouse operation and program efficiency. Participate the inventory counts activities and ensure the stock accuracy at all the responsible warehouses locations Reporting Provide SCMR Report on the supply chain activities in IRC Maesot Offices and submit to SC Bangkok on monthly basis Provide asset and inventory report on the grant-end, year-end and in accordance with the donor requirements Perform other duties as assigned by supervisor Report to: Deputy Field Coordinator for Operations
Position directly supervises: Senior Procurement Officer, Senior Supply Chain Officer , Senior Warehouse Officer, Supply Chain Officer and Supply Chain Assistant
Indirect Reporting: Supply Chain Coordinator, Bangkok
External contacts: Vendor-Supplier, Agent, Landlord
Internal: IRC staff Qualifications Job Requirements: Education: Bachelor’s degree in logistics, business administration or relevant professional certification in supply chain management and/or humanitarian logistics is strongly preferred. Work Experience:
At least 4 years’ experience in supply chain management in humanitarian organization, international organization or INGOs would be preferable. Experienced in crisis and respond project in Asia would be a plus Demonstrated Skills and Competencies: Have a high degree of flexibility and ability to deal with constraints Ability to work independently, with high commitment to the assignment and deadlines Good collaborator with effective interpersonal skills Good communication skills Good analytical and negotiation skills Good organizational and leadership skills Team player, fast learner with strong organizational skills Having self-confidence and readiness to be a team player Proficient in Microsoft excel, MS TEAMS and other on-line meeting tools Language Skills:
Proficiency in English and Thai Working Environment: The position is a national post and will be based in Maesot, regularly required to travel to Umphang including Bangkok and Thailand-Myanmar border areas when required. Standards of Professional Conduct
The IRC and IRC workers must adhere to the values and principles outlined in the IRC Way – Code of Conduct. These are Integrity, Service, Accountability and Equality.   In accordance with these values, the IRC operates and enforces policies on Beneficiary Protection from Exploitation and Abuse, Child Safeguarding, Harassment-Free Workplace, Fiscal Integrity, Anti-Retaliation, Combating Trafficking in Persons, and several others. Equal Opportunity Employer: IRC considers all applicants based on merit without regard to race, sex, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. If you are interested, please apply via the link below. https://rescue.csod.com/ux/ats/careersite/1/home/requisition/45509?c=rescue Contact : HR Department

Job Description: Quality Compliance Specialist (New Health Care Company) 3M is establishing two industry-leading companies, creating value through the spin-off of its Health Care business, while 3M will continue to be a global material science leader, focusing our innovation to win in favorable global megatrends and attractive end markets. This new Health Care Company will be a leading global diversified health technology company with: Proven category leadership Exposure to attractive end-markets Innovation mindset driving improved patient outcomes Collaborative customer relationships Deep global regulatory experience Operational excellence and strong cash flow Strong sales growth and profitability with significant recurring sales We expect the creation of the two companies will be completed by the end of 2023. For now, we will continue to operate as one global company. This role is positioned to drive the success of the "New Health Care Company”. Responsibilities: Ensure implementation, monitoring and improving local Quality Management System (QMS) with regulatory compliance across the company in alignment with Healthcare Business Group corporate quality standards and country regulatory requirements Prepare, review, update, track implement and monitor compliance of standard operating procedures Support Quality team in deployment of corporate policy to country local QMS Work closely with cross-functional teams in overseeing and providing regulatory/compliance guidance on operational activities (including customer complaints handling and supplier/subcon management) Support audit(s) activities including internal audit, external audit, supplier audit and regulatory audit Participate in CAPA board meeting to ensure corrective and preventive action is meeting corporate and country regulatory requirements. Ensure timely follow-up, execution, completion of necessary action and review effectiveness of CAPA. Support quality compliance improvement programs/projects Work closely with Management team to improve internal control and governance practices to enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of the operations and process to ensure compliance Serve as the point of the contact in the country on quality compliance matter Conduct and support training activities to cross-functional team in the country in alignment with corporate QMS requirements Support regional Quality Compliance leader to drive and implement any improvement project in country Issue CAPA based on audit findings and follow up through until closure Ensure CAPA effectiveness Conduct and support activity related to Field Corrective Action (FCA). Ensure timely follow-up, execution and completion of necessary action Plan and conduct audit(s) on subcon activity regularly to ensure effectiveness of QMS Identify requirements and establish the process for Issue Review and Escalation to division Leads the Identify and Assess steps within the Issue Review portion of this process. Responsible for documentation and obtaining approvals of the Issue Review Document Responsible for the investigation in issue review Support SEA country compliance specialist in daily operation Other such duties that may be determined by management. Your Skills and Expertise To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Pharmaceutical, Pharmacy or Science or equivalent Minimum 5-10 years of experience in Quality function in a private, public, government or military environment Has analytical skill, able to interpret information and data for routine operational needs. Has good understanding on ISO 13485:2016 or GDP/GDPMDs Certified ISO 13485 or GDPMDS internal auditor is preferred Experience with project management is preferred For current employees, internal transfer restrictions may not apply. For more details, contact your local recruiter/HR team. At TE, you will unleash your potential working with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to create a safer, sustainable and more connected world. Job Overview TE Connectivity's Trade Compliance Teams interpret laws, rules, and regulations regarding shipping and prepare applications for import/export control certifications and licenses. We are building a world class Global Trade Services (GTS) organization and the Industrial Business Unit APAC Trade Analyst is a new position within GTS, that will play a critical role in supporting trade operations and compliance within the Industrial Business Unit (IND BU) in APAC region. The GTS Industrial Trade Analyst serves as a trusted advisor and key team member within TE’s Operational Compliance team for the BU. The purpose of this role is to facilitate TE’s compliance, at the BU level, with import and export regulations in APAC region to enhance global trade compliance, reduce risk, increase responsiveness to issues and opportunities, and support effective operational aspects of international trade. This role reports into GTS IND BU APAC Trade Supervisor and is a key member of the Global Trade Services (GTS) team. As part of the GTS team, the IND APAC Trade Analyst will join a group of professionals who are passionate about ensuring the future growth of the business by providing business solutions for compliance with global trade laws and regulations. The successful candidate will be able to collaborate and thrive in a global environment with focus on APAC region, especially in Thailand while maintaining integrity, taking accountability, and working together. Responsibilities: Trade Compliance Activities in the BU Execute trade operations and provide compliance oversight for the assigned BU in Thailand to ensure TE’s compliance with import/export laws and regulations. Maintain trade operations and compliance activities in accordance with TE policies, procedures, and controls, in collaboration with key stakeholders throughout the Industrial BU Act as a point of contact for Industrial stakeholders on trade-related matters Work with BU stakeholders and counsel to understand business changes and develop trade-related solutions/strategies and controls to ensure compliance. Maintain Industrial-level Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and reporting to ensure efficiency and effectiveness of the operations. Partner with Trade Compliance Professionals and Stakeholders across the Enterprise Partner with GTS Governance to monitor trade compliance regulatory and legislative changes, assess the potential impact to Industrial, and determine the necessary actions and communications to the appropriate stakeholders. Work with GTS Governance team to conduct trade compliance audits and oversee corrective action plans. Partner with GTS Governance to develop and administer effective trade compliance training as required throughout the region and organization. Ensure appropriate utilization of the GTS Operations Service Center for product classification (import and export), restricted party screening, and duty savings compliance, and otherwise ensure proper country of origin determination, valuation, and admissibility. Work with the Operational Service Centers to identify, evaluate and administer opportunities to facilitate trade in a cost-effective and compliant manner (e.g., make use of applicable Free Trade Agreements, Foreign Trade Zones, etc.) Establish and maintain relationships with internal functions, including corporate functions, to encourage awareness of global trade compliance issues, pro-actively identify trade risk and threats, and develop appropriate trade compliance controls. Desired Candidate Profile: Bachelor's degree required (international business, supply chain, law, or related field) 4+ years’ experience in global/regional trade compliance. APAC and Thailand trade compliance experience is a must. Good to have US / Global Trade Compliance experience/ knowledge. Functional knowledge of import and export regulations and familiarity with customs practices in Thailand Knowledge of Thai Export Controls with a good understanding of the US Export Controls (ITAR & EAR) Proven ability to work with variety of business groups, including supply chain, legal, procurement and finance. Experience in close collaboration with customs and export control authorities, Ability to foster teamwork and internal and external relationships. Excellent organizational habits and priority management Customer focused with a commitment to quality. Fluent Thai language skills, other foreign languages as a plus Travel may be necessary in fulfillment of responsibilities. Competencies Values: Integrity, Accountability, Teamwork, Innovation ABOUT TE CONNECTIVITY TE Connectivity is a global technology leader enabling a secure, sustainable, productive, and connected future. Our broad range of connectivity and sensor solutions have been proven in the most demanding environments, enabling advancements in transportation, industrial applications, medical technology, energy technology, data communications, and for the home. With more than 85,000 employees, including more than 7,500 engineers, we work with customers in nearly 140 countries. TE ensures that EVERY CONNECTION COUNTS. Learn more at www.te.com and on LinkedIn, Facebook, WeChat and Twitter. WHAT TE CONNECTIVITY OFFERS: We are pleased to offer you an exciting total package that can also be flexibly adapted to changing life situations - the well-being of our employees is our top priority! •    Competitive Salary Package •    Performance-Based Bonus Plans •    Health and Wellness Incentives •    Employee Stock Purchase Program •    Community Outreach Programs / Charity Events •    Employee Resource Group Across our global sites and business units, we put together packages of benefits that are either supported by TE itself or provided by external service providers. In principle, the benefits offered can vary from site to site.

กำกับดูแลเพื่อให้แน่ใจว่ามีการปฏิบัติตามข้อกำหนดและแนวทางของ บริษัท ตรวจสอบให้แน่ใจว่าผู้ขับขี่ผู้รับเหมาและ / หรือผู้ให้บริการทั้งหมดปฏิบัติตามนโยบายและขั้นตอนของ บริษัท กฎหมายและข้อบังคับ • ทั้งในเรื่องความปลอดภัย การตรงต่อเวลา การควบคุมต้นทุนในการขนส่ง และการขอคืนและเปลี่ยนสินค้า รวมทั้งป้องกันปัญหาเกี่ยวกับสินค้าสูญหายในการขนส่ง และสินค้าเสียหาย • รับเรื่องร้องเรียนเกี่ยวกับผู้ขับและสินค้าระหว่างทางขนส่ง รับรายงานเกี่ยวกับความเสียหายของยานพาหนะหรือการขนส่งสินค้าอุบัติเหตุและสถานการณ์ฉุกเฉิน • จัดการรับหรือส่งสินค้า Are you an experienced Reefer Sales Manager looking for your next step but feel you have hit the ceiling with your current employer? Are you ready to increase your scope and take on a Regional Product Development role innovating our reefer product whilst focusing on Commercial Development? If so, we have the perfect role at cargo-partner for you! We have just had our most profitable year ever and our expansion plans are in full flow having recently opened up new offices in Barcelona and Mexico City this year. We now have over 160 offices in 40 countries and over 4000 employees worldwide with ambitious plans in the pipeline. For over 15 years, we have served our clients across Thailand with our Air, Ocean, Road, and more recently Warehousing product portfolio and as we look to continue our growth, we are recruiting a Reefer Product Development Manager to join our well-established and successful Bangkok team. In this crucial role, the post holder will be responsible for the strategic set-up, implementation and commercial development (hunting new business) for the Sea Temperature-Controlled Logistics Product, with a special focus on the medium term development. This includes a P+L responsibility, directly relevant to his/her Product, which is overlapping with Line Management responsibilities. Key focus areas of the RPM are the product development, procurement and business controlling. As a Reefer Product Development Manager, you will receive an excellent annual salary coupled with a generous bonus scheme, medical insurance and access to an extensive range of cargo-partner company benefits and the opportunity to progress within the company, either in your own country or internationally. In this role, you will playing an integral role in the success of our Indo-ASEAN operation. As we continue to grow our global network there simply could not be a better time to join the cargo-partner family. Your Responsibilities: ·        Responsible for the financial result of the Sea Import & Export Reefer profit centres related to the assigned geographical area ·        Responsible for achieving budget targets defined for the department ·        Manages company’s Reefer business within the assigned geographical area, including its niche segments if applicable (e.g. Pharma, Flexi Tank, Tank Container, Foodstuff, Perishables, etc.) ·        Implements corporate and national product strategy and SOPs within own department ·        Develops the business within own profit centre - gain additional business from existing or new clients ·        Sources and negotiates buying conditions (prices and space allocations) with third parties for business in charge ·        Handles Reefer shipments in compliance with the company’s rules, SOPs and management instructions ·        Responsible for the compliance of each physical and electronic transport file (own and tea’s): collecting all legally and internally required documents and updating all required systems for each handled shipment ·        Informs and collects information from clients, suppliers, agents, partners, customs bodies regarding the handled shipments ·        Performs active sales and market development activities, within the assigned geographical area, for Reefer business and for the applicable niche segments ·        Conducts client visits, alone or jointly with Sales ·        Responds to requests for quotation with appropriate commercial offer, and/or offers full support to Sales in finding appropriate solution and offer, in combination with pricing ·        Participates in the recruitment process of new employees within the department Why join cargo-partner? ·        Fast-paced work environment with quick decision making and autonomy ·        Guaranteed individual path of professional development ·        Competitive salary and benefits package ·        International Logistics service provider looking to grow into the Global Ocean Freight Top 20 by 2025. Become part of our success story! Your Experience: ·        Proven experience in a commercial role within the logistics and cold chain logistics industry ·        Excellent understanding of cold chain solutions and operations covering all modes of international and domestic transportation, customs house brokerage, airfreight, warehousing and distribution and supply-chain management ·        Strong ability to qualify leads and to develop winning customer value propositions. ·        Excellent communication, presentation and negotiation skills. ·        You will have experience driving Reefer Ocean business throughout SEA, extensive experience developing, and selling end-to-end Cold Chain Solutions (Ocean/Air freight, CFS, Cold Storage, Customs clearance, Transportation, Cargo Insurance etc) to Reefer and Pharma clients. You stand out from the crowd if: ·        You have Reefer Sales experience working within a global freight forwarding business or a Liner business ·        5 years’ experience with Cold Chain Logistics background and business opportunities and networks ·        You’re reading this job ad, and thinking of at least 5 customers you can target !! As we endeavor to keep expanding our business in to new regions, we ultimately expect our staff to grow with us and share our success. If you want to join us on our journey then please submit your application below; or if you would like to discuss the role in a little more detail please contact me: jacob.smith@cargo-partner.com Company Introduction: cargo-partner is a privately owned full-range info-logistics provider offering a comprehensive portfolio of air, sea, land transport and warehousing services, with special expertise in information technology and supply chain optimization. The company operates over 140 offices in over 40 countries around the world to create fast and efficient solutions for a wide range of industries. With the SPOT platform, cargo-partner ensures easy cooperation and full transparency throughout the supply chain. As a family-owned business, we are very employee-oriented and want to work with you to develop your career and personal goals. Take a look at our Mission & Vision. Find out more about cargo-partner from our Youtube channel Learn about Life at cargo-partner here If you are looking for a challenging position in an innovative and dynamic international company, we want to get to know you!
